revised_title: Genetic Response to Selection in Cultivated Plants: Gene Frequencies in Varieties of Prunus persica
tldr: This article discusses the genetic response to selection in cultivated plants, focusing on gene frequencies in varieties of Prunus persica (peach). The authors analyze four characters with major effects and mono-Mendelian segregations, such as foliar glands, flesh color, and corolla size, to understand the genetic structure and adaptation of these plants to different environments and selection pressures.
